metrics.description: Counts the number of input and output tokens used by the generative AI client.
Measures the duration of operations initiated by the generative AI client.
Measures the duration of requests processed by the generative AI server.
Measures the time taken to generate each output token after the first one.
Measures the time taken to generate the first token in a successful response.
Time to first token in streaming chat completions
Time to first token in streaming chat completions
Time between first token and completion in streaming chat completions
Measures the end-to-end response time for the client to receive agent execution results.
metrics.metric_version: string: The version of the metric being reported.

attributes.metric_category: string; The category of the metric; Required
attributes.processing_mode: Enum: real-time, batch, on-demand; The mode of processing for the request; Optional
attributes.reporting_frequency: Enum: daily, per-task, real-time, on-demand; The frequency at which the latency is reported; Optional
attributes.collection_method: Enum: instrumentation, manual logs, OTel; The method used to collect the latency data
attributes.outcome_justification: string: The justification for the outcome of the request; Optional

traces.description: The name of the operation being performed. [1]
The Generative AI product as identified by the client or server instrumentation. [2]
Describes a class of error the operation ended with. [3]
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required if the operation ended in an error

traces.description: Free-form description of the GenAI agent provided by the application.
traces.examples: Helps with math problems; Generates fiction stories
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required If provided by the application.

traces.description: The unique identifier of the GenAI agent.
Human-readable name of the GenAI agent provided by the application.
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required If provided by the application.

traces.description: Represents the content type requested by the client. [4]
The target number of candidate completions to return.
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required if available, in the request, and !=1

traces.description: The name of the GenAI model a request is being made to. [6]
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required If provided by the application.

traces.description: Requests with same seed value more likely to return same result.
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required if applicable and if the request includes a seed

traces.description: The temperature setting for the GenAI request.
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required If provided by the application.

traces.description: The top_p sampling setting for the GenAI request.
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required If provided by the application.

traces.description: GenAI server port. [7]
The encoding formats requested in an embeddings operation, if specified. [8]
The frequency penalty setting for the GenAI request.
The maximum number of tokens the model generates for a request.
The presence penalty setting for the GenAI request.
List of sequences that the model will use to stop generating further tokens.
Array of reasons the model stopped generating tokens, corresponding to each generation received.
The unique identifier for the completion.
The name of the model that generated the response. [9]
The number of tokens used in the GenAI input (prompt).
The number of tokens used in the GenAI response (completion).
GenAI server address. [10]
The top_p sampling setting for the GenAI request.
traces.requirement_level: Conditionally Required If provided by the application.

traces.description: The prompt sent to the GenAI model.
The completion generated by the GenAI model.
traces.examples: AI is the future of humanity.

traces.description: The name of the model that generated the response.
The number of tokens used in the GenAI completion.
The number of tokens used in the GenAI prompt.
The number of tokens used in cache creation input.
The number of tokens used in cache read input.
The type of token used in the GenAI operation.
The type of LLM request being made.
The total number of tokens used in the LLM operation.
The type of tokens used in the LLM operation.
The user initiating the LLM request.
Headers sent with the LLM request.
The top_k sampling setting for the LLM request.
Indicates if the LLM response is streamed.
The frequency penalty setting for the LLM request.
The presence penalty setting for the LLM request.
List of sequences that the LLM will use to stop generating further tokens.
Functions requested in the LLM operation.
The repetition penalty setting for the LLM request.
The reason the LLM response finished.
The reason the LLM response stopped.
A chunk of the completion content generated by the LLM.
traces.examples: This is a chunk of text.

traces.description: The system fingerprint for OpenAI responses.
The base URL for the OpenAI API.
The version of the OpenAI API being used.
The type of OpenAI API being used.
The vendor of the vector database.
The operation being performed on the vector database.
The top_k setting for vector database queries.
Track the path of a message from sending to receiving, which can help in diagnosing delays or failures in message routing.
Tracing to capture performance-related data, like processing time for different operations within the gateway and agent.
The kind of span being recorded, such as client, server, producer, or consumer.
The condition under which the span starts, such as which agent or tool initiated the action.
The condition under which the span ends, such as which agent or tool completed the action.
The method used to collect the trace data
The rate at which data is sampled, percentage of traces retained for analysis.

values.description: A fallback error value for undefined custom errors
JSON object with known or unknown schema

events.description: Describes the instructions passed to the Generative AI model

attributes.role: string: Role of the message author.
string: Role of the message author.

attributes.finish_reason: string: Why the model stopped generating tokens.
attributes.index: int: Index of the choice in the list.

events.description: This event describes the response from a tool or function call passed to the GenAI model.
Log query embeddings. The values can either be either vector, sparse_vector or queries
Generic event for tracking agent interactions.

attributes.error_message: string: Error msg associated with the agent; Optional;
attributes.event_type: string: The type of the event; Required;
attributes.event_source: string: The source of the event; Optional;
attributes.agent_id: string: The ID of the agent; Optional;
attributes.agent_role: string: The role of the agent. Optional;
attributes.agent_version: string: The version of the agent; Optional;
attributes.input_data: AnyValue: The input data for the event; Optional;
attributes.output_data: AnyValue: The output data for the event; Optional;
attributes.tool_used: string: The tool used in the event; Optional;
attributes.recipient_agent_id: string: The ID of the recipient agent; Optional;
attributes.channel: string: The communication channel used; Optional;
attributes.status: string: The status of the event; Optional;
attributes.error_code: string: The error code, if any; Optional;
attributes.retry_attempt: int: The number of retry attempts; Optional;
attributes.policy_triggered: string: The policy triggered by the event; Optional;
attributes.policy_decision: string: The decision made by the policy; Optional;

values.description: Ensures only authorized agents interact with each other.
Tracks IOA components to refine integrations with external APIs.
Shows how often IO Mapper is needed to normalize agent data.
Identifies common developer frustrations when searching for agents.
If nodes frequently change how many connections they have, the topology is dynamic.
Record successful or failed subscription attempts to the gateway.
Log when connections to the gateway are established or terminated.
Capture when a message is sent or received, along with the sender and receiver details.
Identify problematic agents that need debugging or better training data
Identifies which agents work well together for multi-agent tasks
